description: From Latin asyndeton, from Ancient Greek ἀσύνδετον (asúndeton, “unconnected”).

nouns.description: asyndeton (countable and uncountable, plural asyndetons or asyndeta)

entries.meaning: (rhetoric) A stylistic scheme in which conjunctions such as "or" and "and" are deliberately omitted from a series of words, phrases, or clauses.
